impact-statement: The strain of <italic>Phytophthora infestans</italic> that caused the Great Famine in the late 1840s was caused by a single genotype that is distinct from, but closely related to, the most prevalent modern genotype.

contribution.con1: KY, Processed sequencing reads of modern strains, identified SNPs, performed phylogenetic, genome-wide and effector gene analyses, discussed interpretation and wrote the manuscript
contribution.con2: VJS, Extracted DNA from herbarium samples and prepared genomic libraries
contribution.con3: LMC, Processed sequencing reads of modern strains and performed genome-wide and effector genes analysis
contribution.con4: MP, Coordinated sequencing of modern strains in Norwich
contribution.con7: CL, Coordinated sequencing of historic and modern strains in Tübingen
contribution.con8: FNM, Performed mtDNA haplotype analyses for choosing modern strains for genome sequencing
contribution.con9: SK, Conceived the project, coordinated the collaborative effort, discussed interpretation and wrote the manuscript
contribution.con12: MT, Conceived the project, coordinated the collection and sampling of herbarium strains, discussed interpretation and wrote the manuscript
contribution.con13: HAB, Conceived the project, coordinated the collaborative effort, processed sequencing reads of modern and historic strains, identified SNPs, performed phylogenetic analysis, discussed interpretation and wrote the manuscript
contribution.con10: DW, Conceived the project, coordinated the collaborative effort, discussed interpretation and wrote the manuscript
